clinical_study.brief_title: Transfer Effects of Combined Attentional Filter Exercise and Transcranial Direct Current Stimulation
clinical_study.official_title: Cognitive Transfer Effects on Working Memory and Higher Cognitive Functions by Combined Attentional Filter Exercise and tDCS in Healthy Younger Adults

brief_summary.textblock: Investigation of how a single session of an attentional filter exercise of distractor inhibition combined with tDCS modulates cognitive functions like working memory, decision making and attentional control.

detailed_description.textblock: The study is designed as a between subject design with two groups defined by real or sham tDCS. The distractor inhibition exercise is conducted under either sham or real tDCS. Cognitive performance is assessed pre and post tDCS application, complemented by a short-termed follow-up on a consecutive day. Interindividual working memory capacity at baseline is taken into consideration.

primary_outcome.measure: Performance change in computerized attentional filter exercise
primary_outcome.time_frame: 45 minutes on 1st day (pre) and on consecutive day (post)
primary_outcome.description: attentional filtering performance (in % correct), effects of distractor interference for different set sizes

primary_outcome.measure: Reaction change in computerized attentional filter exercise
primary_outcome.time_frame: 45 minutes on 1st day (pre) and on consecutive day (post)
primary_outcome.description: reaction times (in milliseconds), effects of distractor interference for different set sizes

primary_outcome.measure: Performance change in working memory and filtering performance
primary_outcome.time_frame: 30 minutes per pre-assessment, post assessment directly after intervention and short-termed follow-up on the consecutive day
primary_outcome.description: Working memory and filtering performance (in % correct), effects of distractor interference for different set sizes

primary_outcome.measure: Reaction change in working memory and filtering performance
primary_outcome.time_frame: 30 minutes per pre-assessment, post assessment directly after intervention and short-termed follow-up on the consecutive day
primary_outcome.description: reaction times (in milliseconds), effects of distractor interference for different set sizes

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 10 minutes per pre-assessment and short-termed follow-up on the consecutive day
secondary_outcome.description: computerized spatial span forward and backward

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 7 minutes per pre-assessment, post assessment directly after intervention and short-termed follow-up on the consecutive day

secondary_outcome.description: Assessment of trait anxiety via State-Trait-Anxiety-Inventory on first day

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 2 minutes on first and consecutive day
secondary_outcome.description: Daily assessment of state anxiety via State-Trait-Anxiety-Inventory at the beginning of each testing day

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 10 minutes on first and consecutive day
secondary_outcome.description: daily questionnaire assessing subjective rating of sleep of the previous night on 5- to 7-point Likert format and open questions (subjective quality of sleep, current fatigue, duration of sleep); no total score

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 5 minutes on first and consecutive day
secondary_outcome.description: self developed questionnaire assessing subjective performance in tested paradigms (5-point Likert format); no total or sub score; Question 1: How difficult would you rate the task? (lowest (1) = very difficult; highest (5) = very easy) Question 2: Do you think your performance changed in the course of the task? (lowest (1) = strongly worsened; highest (5) = strongly improved)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 5 minutes on first and consecutive day
secondary_outcome.description: reporting of used strategies in tested paradigms (open questions; subjects reported in written notes); self developed questionnaire for qualitative analyses of task demands; no scores; Question: Did you use a strategy? If so, please explain shortly.

arm_group.description: one session of computerized change detection attentional filter exercise (selective attention) combined with real tDCS
one session of computerized change detection attentional filter exercise (selective attention) combined with sham tDCS

intervention.description: sham or real tDCS for 10 minutes of 1.5 milliampere (mA) tDCS targeting the prefrontal and the posterior parietal cortex

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- right-handed
- aged between 18 and 30 years
- normal or corrected to normal vision
- German-speaking
Exclusion Criteria:
- dyschromatopsia
- neurological or neuropsychiatric diseases
- low seizure threshold
- neurological medication
- metal implants in the head
